Move the transmission rearwards without jerking. f) Align the trolley to the proper position below the Never jerk the transmission as it could cause damage to transmission. the drive pinion, pilot bearing, clutch disc, dowel pin etc. aNsOfaTsEf: For removing the gear box assy from vehicle jack up the 2nd front axle (Applicable for Pro 6048) 43-59

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE Clutch centring Center the clutch disc with Clutch Alignment Arbor (special tool). 5 i) Lock up the transmission by using locking chain. j) Gently lower down the jack, pull it back a little to disconnect main shaft from clutch assembly then fully lower down the jack and take out transmission assembly from vehicle. 7 Supporting Transmission Clutch Alignment Arbor Use a transmission jack and support the transmission. (refer special tools for part no) Key Points For Installation 1) Check the drive pinion splines for rust. If rust is found, remove it by wire brushing. Apply grease to the clutch disc sliding surface of the drive pinion, with fingers. Slide the release bearing two or three times to remove excess grease from outside. (Do not remove grease from the cylindrical portion Support 6 over which the release bearing slides). 8 NOTE: If excess grease is not removed, grease could drip, causing clutch slippage. 43-60

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE 3) Clean the fly wheel housing and clutch housing mounting surface and tighten to specified torque. Pouring Transmission Oil After the transmission is installed, pour oil until it overflows from the inspection port. For oil Qty. Please refer specifications table Apply THREEBOND 1105D or equivalent to the threads of the inspection plug and drain plug 9 Inspection plug Drain plug 43-61

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE Positioning the transmission trolley Draining Transmission Oil a) Remove the drain plug to drain transmission oil. e) Place the Transmission trolley (ST000095) under the transmission assembly and raise the trolley according to transmission height. Drain plug b) Check the gear oil quantity, when discharged. Particularly check for metal pieces and chips. The drain plug is made of magnet and hence it will have metal pieces and chips adhering on its surface. 1. Transmission 2. Transmission trolley - ST000095 NOTES : For removing the transmission assembly out of vehicle, EATS assembly needs to be removed first. Refer EATS f) Remove transmission housing mounting bolts service section for its removal procedure. mounted with flywheel housing. NOTE : Before removing the transmission assembly from vehicle, need to remove engine mounted DOC (Applicable for OBDII buses). c) Disconnect shift cable and select cable from shift lever and select lever from transmission side. d) Disconnect propeller shaft and other attaching components like booster connection, sensor electrical connection from transmission side. E0216E 43-59

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE NOTES : To remove the transmission from the engine. Insert a screw driver into the grooves in the clutch housing. Caution : Move the transmission rearwards without jerking. Never jerk the transmission as it could cause damage to the drive pinion, pilot bearing, clutch disc, dowel pin etc. g) Gently lower down the trolley pull it back a little to disconnect main shaft from clutch assembly then fully lower down the trolley and take out transmission assembly from vehicle. NOTES : Transmission assembly to be taken out from STC (Side Tyre Carrier) hatch provided on LH side of vehicle. Supporting Transmission Use a transmission jack and support the transmission. Support 43-60

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE 6019 HD BUS e) Remove the LH side tyre. Draining Transmission Oil a) Remove the drain plug to drain transmission oil. f) Remove the LH side shock absorber & leveling valve. Drain plug Leveling valve LH Side Shock absorber b) Check the gear oil quantity, when discharged. Particularly check for metal pieces and chips. The drain plug is made of magnet and hence it will have metal pieces and chips adhering on its surface. g) Remove the anti-roll bar & front air suspension cross member before placing transmission trolley. Front Air suspension cross member Anti roll bar c) Disconnect shift cable and select cable from shift lever and select lever from transmission side. d) Disconnect propeller shaft and other attaching components like booster connection, sensor electrical connection from transmission side. h) Place the Transmission trolley (ST000095) under the transmission assembly and raise the trolley according to transmission height.

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE j) Gently lower down the trolley pull it back a little to disconnect main shaft from clutch assembly then fully lower down the trolley and take out transmission assembly from vehicle. NOTES : Transmission trolley ST000095 Transmission assembly to be taken out from side hatch (Side hatch to be provided on CWC vehicle) Transmission I) Remove transmission housing mounting bolts mounted with flywheel housing. LH Side hatch Supporting Transmission Use a transmission jack and support the transmission. E0216E NOTES : To remove the transmission from the engine. Insert a screw driver into the grooves in the clutch housing. Caution : Move the transmission rearwards without jerking. Never jerk the transmission as it could cause damage to the drive pinion, pilot bearing, clutch disc, dowel pin etc. Support

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE Pro Skyline AMT Buses a) Disconnect battery cable (- ve) from battery terminal. b) Chock the wheel of vehicle. 1. SLU (Shift Unit Level) 2. Wiring harness e) Disconnect propeller shaft and other attaching components like booster connection, sensor electrical connection from transmission side. c) Remove the drain plug to drain transmission oil. Collect the oil in basket. Drain plug f) Disconnect the electrical and pneumatic connections from PCA. NOTES : For removing the transmission assembly out of vehicle, EATS assembly needs to be removed first. Refer EATS service section for its removal procedure. d) Disconnect all SLU connection from transmission side. 1. Electrical connection 3. Pneumatic Clutch Actuator (PCA) 2. Pneumatic connection 4. Bleed port

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE g) Disconnect all electrical and pneumatic connections j) Place the Transmission trolley under the transmission from X-Y Actuator. assembly and raise the trolley according to transmission height h) Open four bolt of Service Hatch Provided in inner bus k) Remove transmission housing mounting bolts body for Transmission and remove hatch. mounted with flywheel housing. To remove the transmission Insert a screw driver into the grooves in the clutch housing. l) Lock up the transmission by using locking chain m) Gently lower down the jack, pull it back a little to disconnect main shaft from clutch assembly then fully lower down the jack and take out transmission assembly from vehicle by using STC hatch. i) Remove XY actuator from hatch by opening the 4 bolt of XY actuator for removing the transmission. n) Use a transmission jack and support the transmission

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE Clutch centring 2) Clean the fly wheel housing and clutch housing Center the clutch disc with Clutch Alignment Arbor mounting surface and tighten to specified torque. (special tool). Pouring Transmission Oil After the transmission is installed, pour oil until it overflows from the inspection port. For oil Qty. Please refer specifications table Apply THREEBOND 1105D or equivalent to the threads of the inspection plug and drain plug Clutch Alignment Arbor (refer special tools for part no) Key Points For Installation Inspection plug Drain plug 1) Check the drive pinion splines for rust. If rust is found, remove it by wire brushing. Apply grease to the clutch disc sliding surface of the drive pinion, with fingers. Slide the release bearing two or three times to remove excess grease from outside. (Do not remove grease from the cylindrical portion over which the release bearing slides). NOTES : If excess grease is not removed, grease could drip, causing clutch slippage. 43-61

page.text: 43 SERVICE PROCEDURE 5.16.4 ACTIVE AND INDUCTIVE SPEED SENSOR 5.16.5 LEARNING PROCEDURE 5.16.4.1 Disassembly Vehicle Learning Process is a process in which AMT adjusts a) Disconnect the electrical harness connection from itself with different parameters of the vehicle for accurate sensors. and precise operations. b) Loosen bolt to remove active & inductive speed sensors Need: After any repair, components change, service wear and O-ring. and tear or initial fitments reasons any parameter being 1 used by AMT may change necessitating need of learning. a) Ensure the Parking brake is ON 5 b) Switch off ignition and BATTERY CUT OFF SWITCH wait 3 for 30 seconds 2 2 4 5 1 1. Electrical harness connection 4. Inductive speed sensor 2. Bolt with spring washer 5. O-ring 3. Active speed sensor 5.16.4.2 Assembly a) Install the O-ring, active & inductive speed sensors and tighten with bolt. b) Connect the electrical harness connection on sensors. c) Press both neutral button and function button and then switch on Battery cutoff and ignition switch(Ensure 1 both buttons should be pressed up to the completion of learning process). 5 d) Now clutch learning will happen 3 e) After clutch learning the N (Flashing N) will be displayed 2 in the display. 2 4 5 f) Crank the engine within 10 secs and then the gear learning will start (ensure both buttons pressed up 1 until completion) 1. Electrical connection harness 4. Inductive speed sensor g) After the Gear learning, the N will be continuously 2. Bolt with spring washer 5. O-ring present in the display (Which indicates that the learning 3. Active speed sensor is successfully completed) h) Switch off the ignition and wait for 30 seconds i) Switch ON ignition. N should be displayed on dashboard. NOTES : If learning is stopped then check the error codes and rectify error then repeat the learning process 43-139

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE 5.16.6 STOPPING THE VEHICLE a) When the vehicle speed decreases towards zero, SLU disengages clutch automatically to prevent engine stall. b) When the vehicle is stopped while in automatic mode and a gear engaged, the SLU initiates a shift to the appropriate starting gear (depending upon the load). c) If a gear remains engaged for a predefined time of 3 minute while vehicle stopped and ignition ON, SLU intends to shift to neutral. Driver can prevent this automatic shift to neutral by gently depressing the accelerator pedal for a short time. This automatic shift is initiated in both manual and automatic mode. NOTES : This function is implemented to protect the clutch. a) If the clutch remain in close condition, gear also in engage condition and vehicle stopped, switch off the engine ignition and battery cut off. Switch ON the battery and engine ignition, the clutch will automatically open if the air pressure is sufficient (min. 6.5 bar). b) If the clutch remain in close condition, gear also in engage condition, and vehicle gets stopped. Due to electrical and pneumatic line failure no air pressure in the pneumatic line and no current supply in SLU. Then in such case pressurized air should be supplied by any external source to PCA through bleed valve, to open the clutch. After that vehicle can be moved / toed to nearest service station for repair. Bleed valve 43-140

Screw 2. SLU NOTES : b) Loosen and remove SLU to bracket mounting bolts. Hence do marking carefully take out SLU. while removing to avoid incorrect installation. c) Remove the rubber boot by pulling it upward. 1 3 4 2 1 1. SLU 3. Bracket 2. Bolt 4. Wiring harness connector 5.16.2 Disassembly a) Remove all the three switches by pressing gently. 1. Rubber boot Caution : Sharp edge tools should not be used to remove rubber boot . 43-131

NOTES : If connections are incorrect, wrong information will be displayed in the dashboard. Hence do marking carefully while removing to avoid incorrect installation. Contact pins d) Use the two projected pins for prefixing the SLU in its mounting bracket. Projected pins 43-132

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE 5.20 MANUAL LEARNING PROCEDURE Vehicle Learning Process is a process in which AMT adjusts NOTES : itself with different parameters of the vehicle for accurate and precise operations. If learning is stopped then check the error codes and rectify error then repeat the learning process Need: After any repair, components change, service wear and tear or initial fitments reasons any parameter being used by AMT may change necessitating need of learning. a) If the clutch remain in close condition, gear also in a) Ensure the Parking brake is ON engage condition and vehicle stopped, switch off the b) Switch off ignition and battery cut off switch wait for engine ignition and battery cut off. Switch ON the 120 seconds battery and engine ignition, the clutch will automatically open if the air pressure is sufficient (min. 6.5 bar). b) If the clutch remain in close condition, gear also in engage condition, and vehicle gets stopped. Due to electrical and pneumatic line failure no air pressure in the pneumatic line and no current supply in GSU. Then in such case pressurized air should be supplied by any external source to PCA through bleed valve, to open the clutch. After that vehicle can be moved / toed to nearest service station for repair. c) Switch ON the battery cut off switch and ignition switch then press the neutral and function button simultaneously.(Ensure both buttons should be pressed up to the completion of learning process). Bleed valve d) Now clutch learning will happen e) After clutch learning, buzzer sound will come and N (Neural) Symbol will display in cluster. f) After buzzer sound, crank the engine immediately and then the gear learning will start (ensure both buttons pressed up until completion) g) After the Gear learning, the N will be continuously present in the display (Which indicates that the learning is successfully completed) h) Switch off the ignition and wait for 30 seconds I) Switch ON ignition. N should be displayed on dashboard. 43-140

43 SERVICE PROCEDURE Clutch learning failure analysis If clutch learning failed please refer below guidelines Guideline a) Ensure the PCA standout 90.5+/-3 mm b) Ensure the PCA push travel : 19.2~22.4 mm Air Gap : 0.2~1.88 mm c) If PCA push rod is not moving , please check air pressure is sufficient (8 Bar) d) Check the push rod length i.e. 121.5 mm Input / Passive speed sensor Active / Output speed sensor a) Air Gap between pole wheel and input speed sensor should be 0.2 to 0.7 mm for proper gear shifting b) Identification : Input speed sensor connector black in color c) Mating female connector having sticker with mentioning Passive speed sensor d) Mounted on Idler cover as shown e) If Rev gear will not engage check the input and output speed sensor connectors are properly fitted or not. a) Air Gap between pole wheel and sensor should be 0.2 to 1.8 mm for proper gear shifting b) Identification : Output speed sensor connector orange in color c) Mating female connector having sticker with mentioning Active speed sensor d) Mounted on Rear cover as shown Air Gap : 0.2~0.7 mm e) If Rev gear will not engage check the input and output speed sensor connectors are properly fitted or not
